text:
OK, now I'm confused and must
have missed something. What is "Edge for Business"? I thought all Win10 installs
since [some version] came with Chromium-based Edge. Prior to [some version], I
was deploying "Edgium" to replace the original Edge, but I've stopped in the
belief that the built-in Edge was the same as the download. Are their two
versions -- Enterprise and Consumer -- of Chromium Edge? Do I need to be
installing "Edge for Business" in Win10 in order to properly/fully manage Edge
settings? Thanks, Erich On Monday, February 5, 2024 at 20:25, Sysadminbeard
eloquently inscribed:

metadata.topic: Re: Is the registry key for controlling Edge MicrosoftEdge or just plain Edge?
metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] Re: Is the registry key for controlling Edge MicrosoftEdge or just plain Edge?
metadata.email_text_original:
[You don't often get email from erich@albany.edu. Learn why this is important at
https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification ] OK, now I'm confused and must
have missed something. What is "Edge for Business"? I thought all Win10 installs
since [some version] came with Chromium-based Edge. Prior to [some version], I
was deploying "Edgium" to replace the original Edge, but I've stopped in the
belief that the built-in Edge was the same as the download. Are their two
versions -- Enterprise and Consumer -- of Chromium Edge? Do I need to be
installing "Edge for Business" in Win10 in order to properly/fully manage Edge
settings? Thanks, Erich On Monday, February 5, 2024 at 20:25, Sysadminbeard
